revised_title: Investigating the Mysterious Failure of Haddocks on Northumberland, Durham, and Yorkshire Coasts
tldr: The author investigates the mysterious failure of haddocks on the coasts of Northumberland, Durham, and Yorkshire. He explores various theories, including the impact of volcanic matter from an eruption in Iceland, which may have caused the destruction and failure of haddocks since 1789. The author also mentions the large quantities of dead haddocks found floating on the surface of the sea, which could be a result of the mysterious event.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Marine Biology
